response_parsed.title: Designing Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on designing event-driven systems using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers key concepts, implementation, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: Setting up a basic FastAPI application
Using WebSockets for real-time event communication
version_notes: WebSockets support was added in FastAPI version 0.64.0.
caveats: Ensure your FastAPI application is running on a compatible web server (e.g., uvicorn) to handle WebSocket connections.
FastAPI's event-driven capabilities are primarily focused on HTTP and WebSockets; for other event types, consider using external libraries or messaging queues.
